subs.text: 1/3 Reviewing the agenda for an upcoming Future of Thinking conference I realize -- if this really is the future -- we lost. Yet another promising tech that is going to be fought over like social media before it, and web browsers before that and PC operating systems before that
subs.rawText: 1/3 Reviewing the agenda for an upcoming Future of Thinking conference I realize -- if this really is the future -- we lost. Yet another promising tech that is going to be fought over like social media before it, and web browsers before that and PC operating systems before that

subs.text: 2/3 -- winner take all and users be damned. It's not too late to make #toolsforthought a rare exception, where no company can lock their users in, and keep them from switching, where every product has to do everything and therefore does nothing well, and no one has the incentive
subs.rawText: 2/3 -- winner take all and users be damned. It's not too late to make #toolsforthought a rare exception, where no company can lock their users in, and keep them from switching, where every product has to do everything and therefore does nothing well, and no one has the incentive

subs.text: 3/3 to make their products better and their users more powerful thinkers.
subs.rawText: 3/3 to make their products better and their users more powerful thinkers.

subs.text: As an elder of this industry, I can't stand by and say nothing, not that I could when I was just a young whippersnapper. For whatever reason I insist on my products being open to competition, and that makes it harder to win, and so be it. That's the way it should be! ;-)
subs.rawText: As an elder of this industry, I can't stand by and say nothing, not that I could when I was just a young whippersnapper. For whatever reason I insist on my products being open to competition, and that makes it harder to win, and so be it. That's the way it should be! ;-)

subs.text: An aside -- I just got a new Pixel 6 Pro. I still have to carry my iPhone 13 Pro with me, because I wear an Apple watch, and use a bunch of other Apple products that don't work with Androids. Left on its own this is the mess the tech industry *always* creates.
subs.rawText: An aside -- I just got a new Pixel 6 Pro. I still have to carry my iPhone 13 Pro with me, because I wear an Apple watch, and use a bunch of other Apple products that don't work with Androids. Left on its own this is the mess the tech industry *always* creates.

subs.text: It's only when big-minded devs step in, and they do exist, and force the industry to play on a level playing field. And of course then, they try to subvert that influence.
subs.rawText: It's only when big-minded devs step in, and they do exist, and force the industry to play on a level playing field. And of course then, they try to subvert that influence.

subs.text: I agree with Crockford that JavaScript's evolution has only made it worse, but I can't and won't give up on it. I've built a very strong codebase, and I don't use the bloated mess they've added. Further, it can easily be simplified. [link]
subs.rawText: I agree with Crockford that JavaScript's evolution has only made it worse, but I can't and won't give up on it. I've built a very strong codebase, and I don't use the bloated mess they've added. Further, it can easily be simplified.  https://t.co/BLGC4P9ROJ

subs.text:
We should do a profile of JS, A Busy Developer's Guide to JavaScript, and make function calls synchronous by default, and provide an easy way to start a new thread. 

With that we can continue to use all the libraries and tools that make it a rich runtime environment.
subs.rawText:
We should do a profile of JS, A Busy Developer's Guide to JavaScript, and make function calls synchronous by default, and provide an easy way to start a new thread. 

With that we can continue to use all the libraries and tools that make it a rich runtime environment.

subs.text: 1/6 Today was the first time I went to a Tesla supercharger.
subs.rawText: 1/6 Today was the first time I went to a Tesla supercharger.

subs.text: 2/6 I thought I could make it home with 6% to spare, but my Tesla insisted that I should play it safe and get a charge at the charger in New Paltz, NY.
subs.rawText: 2/6 I thought I could make it home with 6% to spare, but my Tesla insisted that I should play it safe and get a charge at the charger in New Paltz, NY.

subs.text: 3/6 Turns out it was at a place I knew well, the Plaza Diner. When I was 17 I hitchhiked up to New Paltz every Friday and often would end up there on my way.
subs.rawText: 3/6 Turns out it was at a place I knew well, the Plaza Diner. When I was 17 I hitchhiked up to New Paltz every Friday and often would end up there on my way.

subs.text: 4/6 I was amazed at how fast their charger runs. It almost felt like filling up a gas-powered car.
subs.rawText: 4/6 I was amazed at how fast their charger runs. It almost felt like filling up a gas-powered car.

subs.text: 5/6 I was also impressed that there was NOWHERE TO PISS. How can you have a place like this with no way for a human to evacuate while the car fills up.
subs.rawText: 5/6 I was also impressed that there was NOWHERE TO PISS. How can you have a place like this with no way for a human to evacuate while the car fills up.

subs.text: 6/6 I was very tempted to just do it, but I held on and waited till I got home.
subs.rawText: 6/6 I was very tempted to just do it, but I held on and waited till I got home.

subs.text:
I went down to NYC to see the Mets, eat hot Chinese food, check out the old neighborhood and get bagels. 

I also had a infinite number of opportunities to get a Covid infection. 

This morning I was going down in a hotel elevator when a family of 5 got on. No masks. üò≥

subs.text:
I'm trying using an Android phone exclusively to see what I give up. Apparently quite a lot.

First question -- I have an Apple Watch. I assume there's no way to use it with an Android phone?

Second -- I subscribe to Apple TV+. There doesn't seem to be an app for Android?

subs.text:
I think Twitter, in its post-Musk hangover, can rise and be a much stronger company than they've ever been. 

Twitter as a company, imho, has never had the chance to focus. 

Their future as a platform, if they grow it the right way, is enormous.
subs.rawText:
I think Twitter, in its post-Musk hangover, can rise and be a much stronger company than they've ever been. 

Twitter as a company, imho, has never had the chance to focus. 

Their future as a platform, if they grow it the right way, is enormous.

subs.text: I downloaded and installed the desktop version of Google Drive, and now it's downloading everything right now. That's what I wanted. Wish I had some control over when it did the download. Oh well. :-)
subs.rawText: I downloaded and installed the desktop version of Google Drive, and now it's downloading everything right now. That's what I wanted. Wish I had some control over when it did the download. Oh well. :-)

Could it learn?

subs.text: 1/2 I've been working outside an office for over 30 years, except for a brief period when i had an office at berkman. because i had the office, i was able to get an experienced radio team (lydon and mcgrath) to work with me on this idea i had for audio blogging (which became
subs.rawText: 1/2 I've been working outside an office for over 30 years, except for a brief period when i had an office at berkman. because i had the office, i was able to get an experienced radio team (lydon and mcgrath) to work with me on this idea i had for audio blogging (which became

subs.text: 2/2 podcasting) and one of my colleagues suggested that blogging would work well with politics, which got the bootstrap of political blogging going. so -- having an office and using it is good. things get created that way that otherwise wouldn't.

subs.text:
I unfollowed @Wirecutter because every time I go there I hit a paywall, even though I am a NYT subscriber. 

I get that it costs more. Fine. But if your links on Twitter always link to a paywall, well I think maybe there should be a way for me to know, eh?

cc @TwitterDev
subs.rawText:

subs.text:
The reason I suggest it is that a link is kind of an ad.

It says if you click here you‚Äôll learn about all this. You see a picture of the product, descriptive text, a pitch.

But when you click you realize you‚Äôve been fooled. 

It could be seen as unethical. False advertising.
subs.rawText:
The reason I suggest it is that a link is kind of an ad.

It says if you click here you‚Äôll learn about all this. You see a picture of the product, descriptive text, a pitch.

subs.text:
@jeffjarvis Jeff, I agree with you on almost everything -- but not this. 

There are plenty of middle class and upper middle class people who vote Republican, still. 

Definitely not trailer trash.

I meet them in various contexts.
subs.rawText:
@jeffjarvis Jeff, I agree with you on almost everything -- but not this. 

There are plenty of middle class and upper middle class people who vote Republican, still.

subs.text: @jeffjarvis Hard to believe educated well-off people don't see the danger, but I have to say I used to vote Republican myself, in the 80s and 90s.
